column2: Okay, the reason why I asked you guys out to brunch today is because I\nhave been doing some thinking about who should be my maid of honor.'
Oh my God! This is it! (She and Phoebe hold hands.) (To Phoebe) I really\nhope it\xc2\x92s you!'
I hope it\xc2\x92s you.'
Me too!'
First of all um, I love you both so much and you\xc2\x92re both so\nimportant to me\xc2\x85'
Okay, bla-bla-bla-bla!! Who is it?!'
Well umm, I was thinking that maybe we could come up with a system where\nwe trade of being maid of honor for each other. Like hypothetically, if Phoebe were\nmine\xc2\x85'
Yes!!! Oh!!'
Hypothetically!'
Still.'
If Phoebe were my maid of honor\xc2\x85'
Uh-hmm.'
Rachel would be Phoebe\xc2\x92s, I would be Rachel\xc2\x92s, that way we all\nget to do it once and no one would get upset.'
Yeah that\xc2\x92s actually a pretty good idea.'
Yeah, I\xc2\x92ll do that. So who gets to be yours?'
(laughs) Well that\xc2\x92s the best part. Umm, you guys get to\ndecide!'
Wh-why is that the best part?'
Because then I don\xc2\x92t have to!'

Well of course we will help you decide! We will do anything we
can to help you! Now, I would like to make a toast, to the future Mrs. Chandler Bing (A
woman at the table behind them overhears Chandler\xc2\x92s name and starts listening
closer), my best friend, and truly one of the nicest people that\xc2\x85'
I\xc2\x92m really not deciding!'
Fine!'
Yeah that\xc2\x92s right.'
Aww, and good luck to you too! (To Monica and Rachel) What a nice lady!'
Die Hard still great!'
Yep. Hey, what do you say we make it a double feature?'
What\xc2\x92d you rent?'
Die Hard 2.'
(looking at the tape) Joey, this is Die Hard 1 again.'
Oh, well we watch it a second time and its Die Hard 2!'
Joey, we just saw it!'
And?'
And it\xc2\x92ll be cool to see it again! Yeah!'
Die Hard!!!!!!'
Dude, you didn\xc2\x92t say Die Hard. Is everything okay?'
Yeah, I just got uh, got plans.'
Well, John McLane had plans!'
No, see the thing is I want to get out of here before Joey gets all\nworked up and starts calling everybody bitch.'
What are you talking about? Bitch.'
Hey Rachel?'
Yeah?'
Umm, when I get married will you be my maid of honor?'
Really?!'
Uh-hmm.'
Oh my God Phoebe! I mean I\xc2\x92m just\xc2\x97Wait a minute. If I\xc2\x92m\nyour maid of honor that means you are Monica\xc2\x92s.'
Oh! Well, if that\xc2\x92s what you want\xc2\x85'
Ohh! No way Phoebe! I want to be Monica\xc2\x92s!'
But why does it even matter?!'
Why does it matter so much to you?!'
Because this one is now! And-and it\xc2\x92s two of our best\nfriends! Who knows what you\xc2\x92re gonna marry!'
What-what if I marry Ross\xc2\x97Or Joey?'
(gasps) You wouldn\xc2\x92t! Okay look, Rachel I know you really want to\ndo this, but I-I\xc2\x92ve never been maid of honor to anyone before! And I know you\xc2\x92ve\ndone it at least twice!'
Yeah but Phoebe\xc2\x85'
And no, oh please, oh please let me finish. (Rachel stops talking.) Oh I\nguess that was it.'
Okay. Okay. It\xc2\x92s\xc2\x97since you\xc2\x92ve never done it before you\ncan be Monica\xc2\x92s made of honor.'
Oh, thank you so much! (They hug.) Okay.'
I\xc2\x92m gonna marry someone good y\xc2\x92know.'
Oh I know.'
Better than Chandler. (Phoebe exhales as if to say, "Like what\nisn\xc2\x92t?")'

Ross's apartment, Die Hard has ended, only I don\xc2\x92t think Joey and
Ross know that yet. As you see, they are both asleep. And they\xc2\x92re on the same couch.
Which means they\xc2\x92re sleeping together. Not like Joey is at one end and Ross is on the
other, they both happen to be lying down and sleeping together. Well, there hasn\xc2\x92t
been any clothes removed so not that kind of sleeping together. Not that
there\xc2\x92s anything wrong with that. That is unless you\xc2\x92re a Republican in which
that kind of thing will bring about the downfall of Western society, especially if they
should happen to want to get married. Anyway, let me recap. No, there is too much, let me
sum up. Ross and Joey are taking a nap together on top of each other and both wake-up at
the same time, realize what they just did, scream, and jump up.]"
What happened?!!'
Well, I don\xc2\x92t know!!'
We fell asleep! That is all.'
Yeah. Yep. Yeah. All right, well uh, I\xc2\x92d better go.'
I think that would be best.'
Yeah. All right, I\xc2\x92ll talk to you later.'
Okay. But not about this!'
No! Never! Never! (Pause, then Joey wants to shake Ross\xc2\x92s hand.) Bye.'
No touch! No touch!'
Yeah hey, a weird thing happened today whey I was at brunch. This woman\noverheard that I was marrying you and-and then she\xc2\x85she wished me good luck.'
That\xc2\x92s sweet.'
No, it\xc2\x92s more like a (sarcastically) good luck.'
So uh, what did this woman look like?'
She was like 30, dark hair, attractive.'
Well, is there any chance you were looking into a bright, shiny thing\ncalled a mirror?'
Come on, was it somebody maybe you dated in college?'
No, no I only dated two girls in college, both blonde, both not\nattractive\xc2\x85 (Thinks a little while.) Hold on one second; let me check this out. (He\ngets up and grabs a photo album.'
What are you doing?'
Well, let\xc2\x92s see\xc2\x85 (Finding the picture he wants.) Okay uh, is\nthat her? (Pointing to the picture.)'
Oh my God yes! Who is she?'
Julie Grath, my camp girlfriend.'
Did you break up with her?'
(pause) No, we\xc2\x92re still together. Yeah we went out for two\nsummers, and then I broke up with her.'
Why?'
Well, \xc2\x91cause she came back the third summer and she\xc2\x92d gotten\nreally fa-aa-aw-ow\xc2\x85'
Fat?!'
I did not say fat! I said, "Fa-aa-aw-ow\xc2\x85"'
You broke up with a girl because she was fat?!'
Yeah. Yeah, but it was a really, really long time ago! Does she still\nfeel bad?'
Well, apparently she does.'
Well, you know what they say, elephants never forget. (Monica is not\namused by that statement.) Seriously, good luck marrying me.'
Hey! What\xc2\x92s going on?'
Phoebe is gonna be Monica\xc2\x92s maid of honor!'
Hey! Well I hope it goes better than the last time you did it for that\ngirl downstairs, remember? (Phoebe glares at him.)'
(shocked) You have been maid of honor before?!!'
See? This is exactly why you shouldn\xc2\x92t lie!'
All right that\xc2\x92s it! I am maid of honor!'
Na-uh, I am!'
How come you are?!'
Because I cared enough to lie!'
Hey-hey-hey-hey, I can help you decide who should do it! Yeah, we could\nhave like uh, like an audition and see how you\xc2\x92d handle maid of honor type\nsituations.'
What are you talking about?'
Like when I want a job, I go to an audition and if I\xc2\x92m the best of\nthe people they see, they give me the part.'
Okay, so after this audition, who decides who gets it?'
Oh uh, me and Ross can be the judges.'
(To Rachel) Well, it\xc2\x92s better than us deciding.'
Oh, come on! This is crazy! Can\xc2\x92t we just flip a coin?!'
No! Coins hate me!'
Okay. Okay fine, y\xc2\x92know what? We will let Ross and Joey decide.\n(Ross enters.) (In a sexy voice.) Hiiiii, Ross! Sweetie.'
Hey there, you handsome thing. (Rachel and Phoebe exit.)'
Wow, this cologne really is every bit as good as Georgio. '
Hi.'
Just uh, brought back your videos.'
Uh hey look uh Ross, look I think we need to talk about before.'
No! No we don\xc2\x92t!'
Yes we do! Now look, that was the best nap I ever had!! '
I\xc2\x85 I don\xc2\x92t know what you are talking about.'
Come on! Admit it! That was the best nap you ever had!'
I\xc2\x92ve had better.'
Okay! When?!'
All right! All right! It was the best nap ever!'
Uh-huh!'
I\xc2\x92ve said it! Okay?! But it\xc2\x92s over Joey!'
I want to do it again.'
We can\xc2\x92t do it again.'
Why not?'
Because it\xc2\x92s weird!'
Fine! Do you want something to drink?'
Sure, what do you got?'
Warm milk and Excedrin P.M. (Ross just leaves.)'
Chandler! (Knocks on the door.) Chandler! I just figured out who you\nare!'
Can you figure out what I\xc2\x92m doing?'
You\xc2\x92re Lewis Posin.'
Who?'
Lewis Posin! He was my best friend in fifth grade, and-and then one day\nI asked him to be my boyfriend and he said no. Do you know why?'
Because you kept talking to him while he was trying to go to the\nbathroom?!'

No! But because he thought I was to faaaaa\xc2\x85. (Chandler emerges,\nwithout flushing by the way.) And every time I think about it, it makes me feel as bad as\nI did in fifth grade! Y\xc2\x92know, I-I really think that you should apologize to Julie.'
What? Are you kidding? That was like 16 years ago.'
No, I know. But y\xc2\x92know what? It would make me feel better if Lewis\napologized to me.'
Okay, I will do it. But I have to warn you; this may make me a better\nperson and that is not the man you feel in love with!'
Okay, all right, this is how it\xc2\x92s going to work. We\xc2\x92re gonna\ngive you hypothetical maid of honor situations and you will be scored on a scale of 1 to\n10, 1 being the highest.'
No, 10 is the highest.'
Why is 10 the highest?'
Because it\xc2\x92s the highest. (Joey shrugs his shoulders) Okay, Rachel\nyou\xc2\x92re up first. (Rachel stands up and gets ready.) Situation No. 1
(crying) I don\xc2\x92t want to marry Chandler!'
Okay, uh\xc2\x85'
I\xc2\x92ve got cold feet.'
\xc2\x85it\xc2\x92s gonna be okay!'
No, one man for the rest of my life? I don\xc2\x92t know if I can do it!\nThis means I\xc2\x92ll never get to sleep with Joey!'

Look Monica, getting cold feet is very common. Y\xc2\x92know,
it\xc2\x92s-it\xc2\x92s just because of all the anticipation and you just have to remember
that you love Chandler. And also, I ran out on a wedding. You don\xc2\x92t get to keep the
gifts.'
(out of his Monica character) Very good! Drawing on your own experience, I\nlike that!'
Thanks!'
Yes, very nice Rachel.'
Thank you judges.'
Ugh, what a kiss ass.'
Oh!'
Okay, Phoebe\xc2\x85'
Yes! Your honor?'
We\xc2\x92re now in the ceremony, Monica is about to say, "I do"\nwhen her drunk uncle starts yelling. What do you do? Go!'
(playing the drunk uncle) When Monica was a little girl, I remember\nthat\xc2\x97(Phoebe screams and tackles him)\xc2\x97Ooh!! Ow! Very good!'
Oh!'
Yes! Excellent! Perfect score!'
Wait a minute! She just made a scene in the middle of the ceremony!'
Hey! Do you want do you want a little taste of Pheebs?!'
It is time for you to give your maid of honor speech.'
Ohh, wait a minute, we haven\xc2\x92t pre\xc2\x85'
Go!'

Okay! Okay! Umm, Webster\xc2\x92s Dictionary defines marriage
as\xc2\x85 (Ross and Joey start writing.) Okay!! Forget that! That sucks!! Okay, never mind!
Forget it! Umm, umm, okay, uh\xc2\x85 I met, I-I met, I met Monica when we were just a
couple of six year olds and I became friends with Chandler when he was 25, although he
seemed like a six year old.'
Oh! That\xc2\x92s nice.'

Thank you. Thank you very much. Umm, I\xc2\x92ve known them separately and
I\xc2\x92ve known them together and-and to know them as a couple is to know that you are
truly in the presence of love. So I would like to raise my glass (Grabs a glass and holds
it up) to Monica and Chandler and the beautiful adventure they are about to embark upon
together. I can think of no two people better prepared for the journey.'
Wow. (To Ross) Good speech.'
Yeah, it really was!'
Aw, thanks!'
Okay Phoebe, I guess you\xc2\x92re next (To Joey) although I really\ndon\xc2\x92t see the point.'
Yeah.'
Okay, I can\xc2\x92t believe that Monica and Chandler are getting married.\nI remember talking about this day with Rachel while we were showering together, naked.\n(Raises her glass and drinks.)'
And she\xc2\x92s back in the game.'
(she opens the door) Julie hi! Chandler Bing, I, I guess you remember\nme.'
Hello Skidmark.'
(To Monica) It\xc2\x92s a nickname, I\xc2\x92ll explain later.'
It\xc2\x92s pretty clear.'
Ah, uh, I owe you a long overdue apology. I never should have broken\nup with you because you were overweight.'
That\xc2\x92s why you broke up with me?'
You-you-you didn\xc2\x92t know that. (Pause as she nods no.) Well, I\nguess my work here is done!'

All right, well first of all I would like to say that you both performed\nvery well. Okay? You should be proud of yourselves. And-and I would also like to say that\nin this competition there are no losers. Well, except for Rachel\xc2\x97Damnit!'
Really?! I won!'
What?!'
I\xc2\x92m sorry Rach, it was, it was really close.'
Well then I demand a recount! (Hmm, I wonder where I\xc2\x92ve heard that\nbefore.)'
Actually, it wasn\xc2\x92t that close.'

No! Y\xc2\x92know what? No! No! You thing was so stupid anyway, this was\nridiculous\xc2\x97We\xc2\x92re gonna flip a coin! (Phoebe gasps.) All right?! (She flips the\ncoin.) Heads! (Looks at the coin and grunts in disgust.)'
The coins have finally forgiven me!'
Well y\xc2\x92know what? I hope Monica forgives you after you throw her,\nher vegetarian, voodoo, goddess circley shower! (Runs out.)'
(running after her) Rach, it\xc2\x92s gonna be okay! (To Ross and Joey)\nYou guys are the best!'
Boy I tell ya, that judging stuff took a lot out of me.'
Yeah?'
Yeah! I was thinking about maybe going upstairs and taking a little nap on\nmy couch. (Raises his eyebrows, questioning Ross to see if he wants to join him.) '
Why-why would I care about that?'
No reason, I\xc2\x92m just saying that uh\xc2\x85 That\xc2\x92s where I\xc2\x92ll\nbe. '
As bad as that went I actually enjoyed myself. I think that I\xc2\x92m\ngoing to apologize for all of the stupid things I do.'
Why don\xc2\x92t you just stop doing stupid things? Then you wouldn\xc2\x92t\nhave to apologize.'
I would really love it if could do both.'
All right, I\xc2\x85I have to ask.'
What?'
Are you gonna break up with me if I get fat again?'
What?!'
Well, you broke up with Julie Grath! How much weight could she have\ngained?'
A hundred and forty-five pounds.'
In one year?! My God what did she eat? Her-her family! That\xc2\x92s not\nthe point.'
Look I know it was a stupid reason to break up with somebody, but I\nwas 15!'
Well\xc2\x85 That\xc2\x92s not the only time this was an issue. You remember\nwhen umm, you spent Thanksgiving with us? You called me fat.'
Okay. Okay, now wait a minute that was totally different.'
How?'
You were not supposed to hear that! I said that behind you back!'
What if I have babies, okay? I mean I\xc2\x92m gonna look different.\nI\xc2\x92m okay with that, but I\xc2\x92m not sure that you are!'

Look you have to realize I don\xc2\x92t think of you as a thin,\nbeautiful woman. (Monica glares at him.) See this is one of things that I can apologize\nfor later! Look, what I mean is you\xc2\x92re Monica! Okay? And I am in love with Monica. '
Keep going.'
So you can balloon up or you can shrink down and I will still love\nyou.'
Even if I shrink down to two inches tall?'
I\xc2\x92d carry you around in my pocket.'
I love you. (They hug and kiss.)'
Skidmark\xc2\x92s still got a way with the ladies.'
Hi Pheebs.'
Hi!'
Hi! I just want to apologize. I\xc2\x92m really sorry I was a baby.'
That\xc2\x92s ridiculous Rachel, we were all babies once. (Rachel looks at\nher.) Oh, you mean today.'
Yeah. Yeah, and y\xc2\x92know you-you deserve to win. And-and y\xc2\x92know\nI was thinking about it, if-if you\xc2\x92re Monica\xc2\x92s maid of honor that means I get to\nbe yours.'
Oh yeah!'
Yeah! Oh, umm when-when Monica and Chandler got engaged I started\nputting some stuff together, y\xc2\x92know just in case\xc2\x85'
Oh that\xc2\x92s so sweet thanks.'

Here is a book of poetry that I know Monica loves. And-and ohh God this
is funny, look, this is a picture of one Halloween where she dressed up as a bride. (Shows
Phoebe the picture.) And look, she made me carry her train, which was weird because I was Wonder
Woman. Oh and here\xc2\x92s a little purse that I found. (Hands her the purse)
Y\xc2\x92know I just thought that maybe they could hold the rings in there.'
Ohh.'
And umm, vintage handkerchiefs y\xc2\x92know \xc2\x91cause, people cry at\nweddings. (Starting to cry.) I\xc2\x92m just gonna grab a couple of these.'
This stuff is great!'

Oh, I forgot this was in here. Umm, this was the uh garter that I was\nsaving for my wedding and I wanted it to be Monica\xc2\x92s something borrowed and it\xc2\x92s\nblue. (Starts to cry again.) Yeah\xc2\x85'
Y\xc2\x92know Rach, I think that, I think you should be Monica\xc2\x92s made\nof honor.'
You do? Why?'
Because I think it means more to you.'
But Pheebs, y\xc2\x92know you earned it.'
Its fine. I mean, this is something that you\xc2\x92ve been thinking about\nsince you were what, 14? (She\xc2\x92s referring to the Halloween picture.)'
No, I was ten. I just developed early.'
(looking at the picture again) Man alive!'
(entering) Hey, what\xc2\x92s going on?'
Hey!'
Well, we just decided that Rachel is gonna be your maid of honor.'

(gasps) Ohh, wow! That\xc2\x92s great! (Rachel and Monica hug.) Oh wow! We
really have to start planning! I have, I have a lot of really specific ideas! We should
probably get together like four times per week. You can come over to my place; we\xc2\x92ll
get together before work! What do you say, 6
Yeah okay, you laugh now, but she\xc2\x92s gonna be yours. (Phoebe gets\nsuddenly scared.)'
Great nap.'
It really was.'
(reacting first by jumping up) Dude! What the hell are you doing?! God!\n(Heads for his room leaving Ross.)'
(slowly stands up and says quietly) Excuse me. (Exits.)'
